intro: Tarenna barbellata, commonly known as the barbellate tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, white flowers are clustered in cymes and are followed by small, round berries. Tarenna barbellata is often found in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests.
